description: A JNLP file is a Java Web Start (JWS) file that contains XML information for launching a Java program over the network. It is saved in Java Network Launching Protocol (JNLP) format. It is used by the Java Web Start (JWS) technology that is an application deployment technology to download and run an application. A JNLP file contains the remote address of the server from which the program is downloaded and launched on local machine.

instructions: Applications that can open JNLP files include Microsoft Visual Studio Code, Notepad, Notepad++, Oracle Java Web Start, Karakun OpenWebStart, and GitHub Atom.
